DOC.brief_summary: This research project aim assess implementation , effectiveness , sustainability pediatric-based intervention aim reduce family ' unmet material need ( food , housing , employment , childcare , household heat , education ) pediatric practice throughout United States .
DOC.brief_title: Implementing Intervention Address Social Determinants Health Pediatric Practices
DOC.detailed_description: The investigator prior work focus develop pediatric primary care-based intervention , `` WE CARE ( Well-child care visit , Evaluation , Community Resources , Advocacy , Referral , Education ) , '' aim address poor family ' material need - food security , employment , parental education , housing stability , household heat , childcare - systematically screen need refer family exist community-based service . To date , investigator test WE CARE primarily community health center ( CHCs ) ; RCT demonstrate WE CARE 's efficacy parental receipt community-based resource . However , 80 % low-income child receive care provider traditional pediatric practice ( i.e . non-CHCs ) . The investigator therefore conduct large-scale , Hybrid Type 2 effectiveness-implementation trial twenty eight pediatric practice US . A step wedge study cluster RCT design use implement WE CARE practice use two common strategy use integrate systems-based intervention primary care - previously facilitate `` on-site '' strategy content expert provide train session on-going consultation ; self-directed `` web-based '' method model American Academy Pediatrics ' practice transformation strategy . The propose study 's specific aim : 1 ) demonstrate non-inferiority self-directed , web-based strategy implement WE CARE , comparison facilitate on-site strategy ; 2 ) demonstrate WE CARE 's effectiveness increase parental receipt community resource ; 3 ) ass sustainability WE CARE pediatric practice . The investigator hypothesize WE CARE equivalent fidelity via two strategy . Based prior work , investigator hypothesize WE CARE significantly increase parental receipt community resource six month post-visit compare usual care . The investigator also expect WE CARE sustain 1- , 2- , 3-years post-implementation ; expect gather data 9,000 chart review , 2,800 parent-child dyad , 150 provider office staff . This proposal significant public health implication delivery primary care low-income child .
DOC.criteria: Parents child age 2 month 10 year whose child present health supervision visit Foster parent , parent speak neither English Spanish , previously enrol parent , parent child receive Medicaid .
